abstract.para:
Note: This document lists changes only since the 1.74.3 release. If you instead want a record of the complete list of changes for the codebase over its entire history, you can obtain one by running the following commands:
svn checkout https://docbook.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/docbook/trunk/xsl svn log --xml --verbose xsl > ChangeHistory.xml

sect1.title: Release Notes: 1.75.0
sect1.para: The following is a list of changes that have been made since the 1.74.3 release.

sect2.title: Gentext
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the gentext code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Check in translations of Legalnotice submitted on mailing list.
Fix spelling errors in Acknowledgements entries.
Check in translations for 4 elements submitted through docbook-apps message of 14 April 2009.

para.literal: David Cramer: locale/zh.xml; locale/ca.xml; locale/ru.xml; locale/ga.xml; locale/gl.xml; lâ‹¯

screen.phrase: Internationalized punctuation in glosssee and glossseealso
Check in fixes for DSSSL gentext targets from submitted patch #1689633.
Check in major update submitted with bug report #2008524.
Check in fix to Note string submitted in bug #2441051.
Checkin typo fix submitted in bug #2453406.

sect2.title: Common
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the common code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Fix extra generated space when xrefstyle includes 'nopage'.

Add support for some format properties on tables using HTML table markup. These include: - frame attribute on table (or uses $default.table.frame parameter). - rules attribute on table (or uses $default.table.rules parameter). - align attribute on td and th - valign attribute on td and th - colspan on td and th - rowspan on td and th - bgcolor on td and th
Add placeholder template to massage olink hot text to make customization easier, per Feature Request 1828608.
Add support for collecting olink targets from a glossary generated from a glossary.collection.
Handle firstterm like glossterm in mode="title.markup".
Add match on info/title in title.markup templates where missing.

Changed "ancestor::title" to "(ancestor::title and (@id or @xml:id))". This enables proper formatting of inline elements in titles in TOCs, as long as these inlines don't have id or xml:id attributes.
Add two new qanda.defaultlabel values so that numbered sections and numbered questions can be distinguished. Satisfies Feature Request #1539045.
Convert function-available(exsl:node-set) to use the new param so Xalan bug is isolated.

Added fixes for bugs #2112656 and #1759205: 1. Reverted mistaken commits r7485 and r7523. 2. Updated the template with match="link" and mode="no.anchor.mode" so that @endterm is used if it exists and if the link has no content.
Added code to handle acknowledgements in book and part. The element is processed similarly to dedication. All acknowledgements will appear as front matter, after any dedications.
Fix bug #2018717 use.local.olink.style uses wrong gentext context.
Fix bug #1787167 incorrect hot text for some olinks.
Fix bug #1669654 Broken output if copyright <year> contains a range.
Fix bug in labelling figure inside appendix inside article inside book.

sect2.title: FO
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the fo code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Inclusion of highlighting code was simplified. Only one import is now necessary.
Add the new fop extensions namespace declaration, in case FOP extension functions are used.
Add support for pgwide on informal objects.
Fixed spurious closing quote on line 134.
Convert function-available for node-set() to use new $exsl.node.set.available param in test.
Backed out previous change. Bob had already fixed it the right way in gentext.xsl.
Suppress extra space after xref when xrefstyle='select: label nopage' (#2740472)
Fixed doc bug for row-height.
Internationalized punctuation in glosssee and glossseealso

para.literal: Robert Stayton: param.xweb; param.ent; htmltbl.xsl; table.xsl

screen.phrase: Add support for some format properties on tables using HTML table markup. These include: - frame attribute on table (or uses $default.table.frame parameter). - rules attribute on table (or uses $default.table.rules parameter). - align attribute on td and th - valign attribute on td and th - colspan on td and th - rowspan on td and th - bgcolor on td and th
Add support bgcolor in td and th elements in HTML table markup.
Add support for colspan and rowspan and bgcolor in td and th elements in HTML table markup.
Fix working of page-master left and right margins.
Fixed bogus cut-and-paste (I assume)

Added a new parameter, bookmarks.collapse, that controls the initial state of the bookmark tree. When the parameter has a non-zero value (the default), only the top-level bookmarks are displayed initially. Otherwise, the whole tree of bookmarks is displayed.
This is implemented for FOP 0.9X. Closes FR #1792326.
Add support for dbfo row-height processing instruction, like that in dbhtml.
Add support for dbfo keep-together processing instruction for entire list instances.
Add support fo dbfo keep-together processing instruction to more blocks like list items and paras.
Add new variablelist.term.properties to format terms, per request # 1968513.
In simple.xlink, rearrange order of processing.
Handle firstterm like glossterm in mode="xref-to".

para.literal: Robert Stayton: glossary.xsl; xref.xsl; pi.xsl; footnote.xsl

screen.phrase: Implement simple.xlink for glosssee and glossseealso so they can use other types of linking besides otherterm.
Add two new qanda.defaultlabel values so that numbered sections and numbered questions can be distinguished. Satisfies Feature Request #1539045.
For the book title templates, I changed info/title to book/info/title so other element's titles will not be affected.
Use param exsl.node.set.available to test for function.
Start using new param exsl.node.set.available to work around Xalan bug.
Add comment on use of t:predicate for editor to prevent extra processing of multiple editors. Fixes bug 2687842.
An indexterm primary, secondary, or tertiary element with an id or xml:id now outputs that ID, so that index entries can be cross referenced to.
Added modeless template for ooclass|oointerface|ooexception. Closes bug #1623468.
Add template with match on indexterm in mode="xref-to" to fix bug 2102592.
Now xref to qandaentry will use the label element in a question for the link text if it has one.
Add id if specified from @id to output for quote and phrase so they can be xref'ed to.
Add support for xref to phrase, simpara, anchor, and quote. This assumes the author specifies something using xrefstyle since the elements don't have ordinary link text.
Fix bug in new toc templates.

para.literal: Mauritz Jeanson: titlepage.xsl; component.xsl; division.xsl; xref.xsl; titlepage.templatesâ‹¯

screen.phrase: Added code to handle acknowledgements in book and part. The element is processed similarly to dedication. All acknowledgements will appear as front matter, after any dedications.
Rewrite toc templates to support an empty toc or populated toc in all permitted contexts. Same for lot elements. This fixes bug #1595969 for FO outputs.
Fix indents for seealsoie so they are consistent.
Removed duplicate (monospace.font.family).
Add glossentry.list.item.properties.
Add monospace.verbatim.font.width param to support @width on programlisting.
Put programlisting in fo:block-container with writing-mode="lr-tb" when text direction is right to left because all program languages are left-to-right.
Add support for @width on screen and programlisting, fixes bug #2012736.
Fix bug #1973585 xref to para with xrefstyle not handled correctly.
Added support for acknowledgements in article. Support in book/part remains to be added.
Fix bug #1787167 incorrect hot text for some olinks.
Add writing-mode="tb-rl" as well since some XSL-FO processors support it.

para.literal: Robert Stayton: autotoc.xsl; lists.xsl; glossary.xsl; fo.xsl; table.xsl; pagesetup.xsl

screen.phrase: Add support for writing-mode="rl-tb" (right-to-left) in FO outputs. Changed instances of margin-left to margin-{$direction.align.start} and margin-right to margin-{$direction.align.end}. Those direction.align params are computed from the writing mode value in each locale's gentext key named 'writing-mode', introduced in 1.74.3 to add right-to-left support to HTML outputs.
Add attribute-sets for formatting glossary terms and defs.
Add writing.mode param for FO output.
Fix bug 1546008: in qandaentry in a TOC, use its blockinfo/titleabbrev or blockinfo/title instead of question, if available. For DocBook 5, use the info versions.
Add better pointer to README for XSLTHL
More tweaking the way that XSLTHL does or does not get called
Alternate attempt at sanely including/excluding XSLTHT code

sect2.title: HTML
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the html code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Removed redundant lang and title attributes on list element inside div element for lists.

para.literal: Robert Stayton: inline.xsl; titlepage.xsl; division.xsl; toc.xsl; sections.xsl; table.xsl;â‹¯

screen.phrase: Convert all calls to class.attribute to calls to common.html.attributes to support dir, lang, and title attributes in html output for all elements. Fulfills feature request #1993833.
Fix bug #2750253 wrong links in list of figures in chunk.html when target html is in a subdirectory and dbhtml filename used.
Inclusion of highlighting code was simplified. Only one import is now necessary.

para.literal: Robert Stayton: chunk-common.xsl; chunktoc.xsl; docbook.xsl; chunk-changebars.xsl; autoidxâ‹¯

screen.phrase: Convert function-available for node-set() to use new $exsl.node.set.available param in test.
Fixed doc bug for row-height.
Internationalized punctuation in glosssee and glossseealso
More elements get common.html.attributes. Added locale.html.attributes template which does the lang, dir, and title attributes, but not the class attribute (used on para, for example).
Replace more literal class atts with mode="class.attribute" to support easier customization.
Support olinking in glosssee and glossseealso.
In simple.xlink, rearrange order of processing.
Handle firstterm like glossterm in mode="xref-to".
Added template named common.html.attributes to output class, title, lang, and dir for most elements. Started adding it to some list and block elements.
Add two new qanda.defaultlabel values so that numbered sections and numbered questions can be distinguished. Satisfies Feature Request #1539045.

para.literal: Robert Stayton: param.xweb; chunk-code.xsl; param.ent; xref.xsl; chunkfast.xsl; verbatim.xâ‹¯

screen.phrase: Use new param exsl.node.set.available to test, handles Xalan bug.
Use named anchors for primary, secondary, and tertiary ids so duplicate entries with different ids can still have an id output.
Add new param index.links.to.section.

Pass through an id on primary, secondary, or tertiary to the index entry, so that one could link to an index entry. You can't link to the id on an indexterm because that is used to place the main anchor in the text flow.
Add support for the new index.links.to.section param which permits precise links to indexterms in HTML output rather than to the section title.
Added modeless template for ooclass|oointerface|ooexception. Closes bug #1623468.

Make sure a qandaset has an anchor, even when it has no title, because it may be referenced in a TOC or xref. Before, the anchor was output by the title, but there was no anchor if there was no title.
Add a template for indexterm with mode="xref-to" to fix bug 2102592.
Now xref to qandaentry will use the label element in a question for the link text if it has one.
Create separate templates for computing label of question and answer in a qandaentry, so such can be used for the alt text of an xref to a qandaentry.
Now support xref to phrase, simpara, anchor, and quote, most useful when an xrefstyle is used.
Rewrite toc templates to support an empty toc or populated toc in all permitted contexts. Same for lot elements. This fixes bug #1595969 for HTML outputs.

para.literal: Mauritz Jeanson: titlepage.xsl; component.xsl; division.xsl; xref.xsl; titlepage.templatesâ‹¯

screen.phrase: Added code to handle acknowledgements in book and part. The element is processed similarly to dedication. All acknowledgements will appear as front matter, after any dedications.
Rewrote primaryie, secondaryie and tertiaryie templates to handle nesting of elements and seeie and seealsoie, as reported in bug # 1168912.
Fix simplesect in toc problem.
Add support for @width per bug report #2012736.
Fix bug #1787140 HTML tables not handling attributes correctly.
Move writing-mode param.

Remove a nesting of

inside

for refclass (made XHTML* invalid, made HTML silly)
Fix bug #1945872 to allow passthrough of colwidth values to HTML table when no tablecolumns.extension is available and when no instance of * appears in the table's colspecs.
Added support for acknowledgements in article. Support in book/part remains to be added.
Fix bug #1787167 incorrect hot text for some olinks.
Fix bug 1546008: in qandaentry in a TOC, use its blockinfo/titleabbrev or blockinfo/title instead of question, if available. For DocBook 5, use the info versions.
Add support for generating olink database when using chunktoc.xsl.
Add better pointer to README for XSLTHL
Another stab at fixing the stupid XSLTHT includes across processors (Saxon regression reported by Sorin Ristache)
More tweaking the way that XSLTHL does or does not get called
Alternate attempt at sanely including/excluding XSLTHT code

sect2.title: Manpages
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the manpages code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Convert function-available test for node-set() function to test of $exsl.node.set.available param.
Added a template for bibliolist. Closes bug #1815916.

sect2.title: Epub
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the epub code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Slightly more nuanced handling of imageobject alternatives and better support in dbtoepub for XIncludes and ENTITYs to resolve Issue #2750442
Add a colon after an abstract/title when mapping into the dc:description for OPF metadata in ePub output to help the flat text have more pseudo-semantics (sugestions from Michael Wiedmann)
Correctly set dc:language in OPF metadata when i18nizing. Closes Bug #2755150
Corrected namespace declarations for literal XHTML elements to make them serialize "normally"
Be a little bit more nuanced about dates
Add DocBook subjectset -> OPF dc:subject mapping and tests
Add DocBook date -> OPF dc:date mapping and tests
Add DocBook abstract -> OPF dc:description mapping and tests
Check in patch submitted by user to add opf:file-as attribute to dc:creator element.
Convert function-available test for node-set() function to test of $exsl.node.set.available param.
Adding --output option to dbtoepub based on user request
Cleaning and regularizing the generation of namespaced nodes for OPF, NCX, XHTML and other outputted filetypes (hat tip to bobstayton for pointing out the silly, incorrect code)

Remove a nesting of

inside

for refclass (made XHTML* invalid, made HTML silly)

Added regression test and fix for XHTML validation problem with <a>s added inside <blockquote>; This potentially causes another problem (where something is referenced by has no anchor, but someone reporting that should cause the whole <a id='thing'/> thing to be reconsidered with modern browsers in mind.

sect2.title: HTMLHelp
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the htmlhelp code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Convert function-available test for node-set() function to test of $exsl.node.set.available param.
Add support for generating olink target database for htmlhelp files.

sect2.title: Eclipse
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the eclipse code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Convert function-available test for node-set() function to test of $exsl.node.set.available param.

sect2.title: JavaHelp
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the javahelp code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Convert function-available test for node-set() function to test of $exsl.node.set.available param.

sect2.title: Params
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the params code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Add default setting for @rules attribute on HTML markup tables.

Added a new parameter, bookmarks.collapse, that controls the initial state of the bookmark tree. When the parameter has a non-zero value (the default), only the top-level bookmarks are displayed initially. Otherwise, the whole tree of bookmarks is displayed.
This is implemented for FOP 0.9X. Closes FR #1792326.
Markup fix.
add a hack in exsl.node.set.available.xml to preserve namespace node and un-break the build
Add new variablelist.term.properties to format terms, per request # 1968513.
Fixed markup errors.
Add two new qanda.defaultlabel values so that numbered sections and numbered questions can be distinguished. Satisfies Feature Request #1539045.
Change default to 1 to match past behavior.
Isolate this text for Xalan bug regarding exsl:node-set available. If it is ever fixed in Xalan, just fix it here.
Add param to control whether an index entry links to a section title or to the precise location of the indexterm.
Added line break.
New attribute list for glossentry in glossary.
New parameter to support @width on programlisting and screen.
Fixed syntax error.
Updated and reorganized the description.
Add caveat about XEP bug when writing-mode is right-to-left.
Change 'left' to 'start' and 'right' to 'end' to support right-to-left writing mode.
Add attribute-sets for formatting glossary terms and defs.
Clarify the description.
Now handles year element containing a comma or dash without error.

sect2.title: Highlighting
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the highlighting code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Inclusion of highlighting code was simplified. Only one import is now necessary.
Adding XSLTHL readme
Alternate attempt at sanely including/excluding XSLTHT code

sect2.title: Tools
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the tools code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Added declarations of direction.align.start and direction.align.end to see if this fixes the recent snapshot build problems.

sect2.title: XSL-Saxon
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the xsl-saxon code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Added a fix that prevents output of extra blank line. Hopefully this closes bug #894805.

sect2.title: XSL-Xalan
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the xsl-xalan code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Added a fix that prevents output of extra blank line. Hopefully this closes bug #894805.

sect2.title: XSL-libxslt
sect2.para: The following changes have been made to the xsl-libxslt code since the 1.74.3 release.

screen.phrase: Pruned away semicolons.
